channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Kiribati, New Zealand, Australia: Which countries are the first to ring in 2026?
Meet Ranjit ‘Ricky’ Gill, Indian-origin Trump adviser, awarded for India-Pakistan ‘ceasefire role’
Warren Buffett retires today: What next for Berkshire Hathaway?
Who is Kaamya Karthikeyan, the youngest Indian to ski to the South Pole?
It’s going to be a quiet 2026 in Sydney, Bali, and Paris. Here’s why
December 31 is the last day to link your Pan and Aadhaar. What happens if you miss the deadline
Ramification | Bangladesh: When law collapses, the mob takes charge
item.description: As per the statement of an MEA spokesperson, more than 2,900 incidents of violence against minorities have been documented by independent sources during the tenure of the interim government

item.title: Pakistan’s forgotten genocide: If Gaza deserves attention, so does Balochistan
item.description: A systematic pattern of violence, including military action, communication blackouts, as well as crackdowns on activists and peaceful protesters, is ongoing in Balochistan

item.title: Khaleda Zia’s death casts a long shadow over Bangladesh’s February elections
item.description: The elections will now be marked by the absence of the two Begums who have influenced and dominated its electoral politics for decades. Their absence is certain to reshape the political contest

item.title: Big, poor and rising: Why India is the world’s punching bag
item.description: India’s rise is uncomfortable at different geopolitical levels for both the US-led West and China

item.title: Top 10 positive highlights of 2025: From science to society
item.description: The year 2025, despite chaos and disruption, also witnessed remarkable breakthroughs in health, science, environment, and social progress, offering hope for the future

item.title: Ishaq Dar’s year-end presser exposes where Pakistan must introspect
item.description: The Pakistani foreign minister fumbled when a journalist pointed out to him that Pakistan’s borders with three of its four neighbours were closed. This needs Pakistan to introspect, but it is incapable of doing so
